group_works.title: Just an accident
group_works.creator_credit: Carol Haslam, BBC-TV and Open University

results.title: Just an accident
results.creator_credit: Carol Haslam, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to Psychology”.
Concerned with the experimental investigation of human factors in road accident causation. Considers individual differences in hazard perception, the problem of where the driver pays attention within the visual field, and how the driver deals with a hazard which has been seen.

results.title: What psychologists do (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to Psychology”.
John Annett looks at work being done by six psychologists in the following areas: acquisition of reading skills, computer assisted learning, vocational guidance, design of industrial machine tools, diagnosis of brain damage, work with chronic, mute schizophrenics. He points out the close relationship between psychological research and its application to real life problems.

results.title: Learning about electric current. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to physical science”.
This film is an introduction to the principles of electricity. Laboratory experiments and animated drawings illustrate the chemical, magnetic and heat effects of electric current. Scenes include such things as copperplating, and the flow of electrons within the filament of an incandescent bulb.

results.title: Learning about sound. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to physical science”.
This film presents the basics of sound, starting with its source - vibrations emanating soundwaves. An oscilloscope visualises the frequency and amplitude of sound waves. An experiment with railway tracks compares the speed of sound through air and through metal.

results.title: Learning about magnetism. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to physical science”.
This film explores the mysteries and practical applications of magnetism. The subject of magnetic fields is dramatised with scenes of a 75-T electromagnet with a magnetic field so huge that its expanse can be viewed only from a helicopter.

results.title: About Trevelyan
results.creator_credit: Peter Scroggs, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to History”.
A discussion between four academic historians about the ways in which the discipline of history, as they study and teach it, makes demands which sharply differentiates it from other kinds of history. They relate these points in the first place to the virtues and defects of some of the work of G. M. Trevelyan. Then B. Dodson of York University, discusses a newspaper series called “The Making of the British” and shows five points at which it departs from what he would consider professional standards of history.

group_siblings.title: Primary sources: the raw material of history

results.title: Primary sources: the raw material of history
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to History”.
The film uses London as a place to show how different primary sources can be used to study its history. The primary sources include an excavated Roman bath-house, early documents, pottery, maps, paintings, business records and archival film.
